caption: I love this place so much , the food and service is amazing especially Stephanie the server. Definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.
Cold pizza, tasted like it was 2 days old, with some tomatoes and basil thrown on it right before delivery. Thanks for the college experience.
Food is bland. Pizza, calzone and pasta taste like frozen reheated stuff. They may have something good there, but it’s definitely nothing invented in Italy.

(Translated by Google) Nice place, before and after some attraction in the Blackes center, sensational dishes, worth it.  (Original) Local agradável, antes e depois de alguma atração no Blackes center, pratos sensacionais, vale apena.

I came here with my sister last month our waitress was a very lovely girl she was very nice & attentive to our table. We ordered the prosciutto pizza a salad with walnuts which was amazing !!! and some rigatoni with mushrooms and cream sauce the best ! I really recommend this place alittle pricy but it was worth it :) I will be returning for sure
Have been here on several occasions, always a pleasant surprise . Specials are amazing.
Very clean and convenient place. They serve large portions and for reasonable rates. We loved the menu a lot and the staff members were very welcoming and explanatory. Highly recommended.
I would not recommend this place. Both fettuccini and pomodoro were too salty and tasted like old flour.

Awful. I am only writing this to let other people know. Fettuccini is dry and tastes like old flour. Pomodoro spaghetti is way too salty and overcooked. Pizza tastes worse than any store bought frozen pizza. Overall, everything tastes absolutely disgusting. We had to throw away everything. We liked this place two years ago but something definitely changed (or they give out low quality food to delivery).
The food is amazing here and the service was one of a kind. So worth a try if you're in the area.

I’m somewhat surprised by such good ratings when this may be one of the worst “Italian” restaurants I’ve ever received food from. Pasta was completely tasteless. Sauce tasted like pure tomato sauce dumped straight from a can. No salt, no garlic, no oregano, no olive oil. Pasta was mushy. Tagliatelle Al Ragu, tasteless. Spaghetti Pomodoro, tasteless.I could’ve opened a can of Chef Boyardee and had more flavor for $2.99 than I had in the TWO bland dishes I paid $50 for. Extremely disappointed. The only reason I gave two stars is because I’m understanding of what restaurants are going through in these times. But seasoning food and food quality should not suffer. I would’ve waited 2 hours in addition to the hour and a half I waited if it meant my food would have been prepared with some flavor. Always salt the pasta water chefs.
Awesome service!
Very good customer services and excellent pizza. Will Definitely recommended it.
Great pastas and other delicious entrees on the menu.  I love this neighborhood gem!

I call this superb restaurant many times  as I love the good mood that is unique to this restaurant. The team is extraordianrillyremarkably attentive and professional. The service is extraordinarily fast. Most important, the food they serve is great. I ate there more than once and I was always happy. The pay is decent. I highly recommend this place to my friends and family.
Great food and cozy ambience. I had their special spinach fettuccine and they bring out the bill in comic books, so unique!!

Sweet, comfortable although the last time I was there it was very noisy. A very loud group of young women made it impossible for my companion and I to talk. The management said nothing, just let the women carry on. Food portions are ample and always good.
Very tight in the pizza place next door if they are busy. Pizza was good. Service was good
(Translated by Google) Friendly local friendly staff to try after a game at the Barkley center  (Original) Locale accogliente personale gentile da provare dopo una partita al Barkley center
(Translated by Google) It's simple, it has a beautiful view and the food is also very good.  (Original) Es simple, tiene una vista linda y además la comida es muy buena.
Homemade pasta and pizza. Very good taste and very professional staff
(Translated by Google) Great option for those who like Italian food. Beautiful space and great service.  (Original) Ótima opção para quem gosta de comida italiana. Espaço bonito e ótimo atendimento.
Very good Italian restaurant.
Great place for a late dinner after events @ Barclays Center

Quaint, relaxed, intimate Italian spot. We love this neighborhood restaurant. Always the freshest plates & pastas. And the service is always warm, friendly and courteous. Always love coming here and I enthusiastically recommend it!
A new discovery! Nice!!

I ordered the regular pizza and it was atrocious.  Zero effort went into making the sauce.  It was bitter and obviously straight from the can.  How can you open a pizzeria, put everything on the line, and serve garbage?  In addition to the awesome food they serve are the rip off prices.  One and done I will never go back here again.
Broccolino was amazing! Our service was great and the food was well worth braving the rainy streets.
Good tasting food but horrible portion sizes. $20 for a meal equivalent to an appetizer.
Great Italian food and beers.
Needed a place to go for a quick late-ish bite that was dog friendly. Unfortunately the margherita pizza we ordered had very little flavor, and the parmesan fries were underwhelming.

Delicious pasta, larger-sized cocktails, fantastic service. The patio area is a cute place to dine and just watch people pass by. Not sure how it all works in inclement weather, but we went on a perfect evening. Definitely plan on coming back.
Excellent food!!!
Excellent little Italian eatery. Small plates but fresh & filling!
Good!!

The place is clean and cozy,  the service is also good, the wine great, but the food wasn't good at all. I asked for a pricey Salmone Alla Griglia, $27.50 with Sautéed Broccoli Rabe which was mixed with Kale. I asked to be cooked medium well. I got a well done salmon, that wasn't fresh. It was on a bed of Kale steams with some hitch of Broccoli. The worst part, beside as I mentioned it wasn't fresh an it was pricey, not only the Kale and Broccoli was salty, but the salmon itself was so salty that couldn't eat it. I told to the waitress about the problem and she said that maybe it was the Broccoli and Kale. She didn't offer me any other suggestion or tried to fix the food, nothing she left. I called her back and I asked her to take the food and bring me the check, which she did and I left. No a word like I am sorry or something else. It was as bad as I am describing it. It was a shame since I was walking for a.long time around 5th Av in Brooklyn looking for a restaurant that I like it but...

Very disappointing.   I consider myself a Brooklyn Pizza Aficionado.  Currently I treat myself to Pizza once a month so I really forward to it. I ordered the spicy salami and added mushrooms.  The salami did NOT taste fresh,  i ended up picking all of the salami off because it was clearly expired. The tomato sauce was very bland, and the crust was rubbery... despite the fact. The mushrooms were decent though undercooked.   If your having a hankering for Pizza in Bedstuy I highly recommend  Daddy Greens, or Pizza Party and though over priced Artichoke is always consistent.   Sadly this place was a complete waste of my cheat day.  😭😭😭😭😭😭
Nice spot

I found this place from a random search for italian food. I had a hankering for some Italian munching and decided to head out to this restaurant. The restaurant has a split opening so I went into the section that had the bar. I was greeted by one of the waitresses and asked if I can sit anywhere, since I was dining alone . I started off with cappuccino and ordered Spinach fettecini in lemon sauce topped with pistachio and shrimp (I added parmesan cheese). It was my first time eating a dish containing pistachio so I was quickly awaken by the pungent aroma.  The lemon sauce added acidicity to taste . Shrimp tasted fresh yet not overly cooked.  Overall I wouldn't order this particular dish again  but I did appreciate the service. 3 stars for presentation of food and 4 stars for service. My waitress was attentive but not overbearing. Also when closing out your meal they deliver the receipt in an Italian comic book. I thought that was original. Grazti!
I love coming to this place for pizza. The staff is absolutely fabulous and the pizza is amazing. You can't go wrong here and I highly recommend it.
Friendly service. Solid pizza.
Service was excellent, food could be seasoned a little more but overall good experience
OK

I’ve been here before and I like the ambiance of it and the owner is a nice guy. But I’ve been repeatedly disappointed about their products, especially with their pizza. I’ve been ordering through Postmates while working late nights and the products delivered were not good. More specifically last night the pizza was below average, the dough was rubbery and I added extra cherry tomatoes and they put two halves (literally, but I mean, that’s and upgrade considering last time they forgot them to begin with).  I mean, I try not to be a super picky Italian but for a $22 pizza I expect way more than this.

Ambience is nice but this place is nothing to get excited about food. Pizza was okay but felt undercooked and didn't feel like fresh ingredients. Broccoli rabe was good.  Overall nicer food in the area for better price.
Excellent food not cheap beautiful outdoor setting
Excellent food and a perfect service!

Andrea is a very welcoming and passionate restaurant owner. He takes cares of your experience and details, and makes you feel at home, while drinking an italian wine and eating an amazing pasta on the outside seating. The beautiful location is even better if you have an event at the Barclay Center.  I tried the margherita pizza as well, very light and crunchy.  A presto e grazie!
We ate the lazania it was the best lazania we at ever! The enters and the desarte was amazing. Graet place!
(Translated by Google) Very well eaten I recommend without problem.  (Original) Très bien mangé je recommande sans problème.
Amazing and unique environment
Delicious pizza!!
Delicious pizza and spinach ravioli! Excellent service. Perfect location for dinner before show at Barclays. Will definitely be back.
very very cozy and food was delicious!!!
Terriffic brick oven pizza

As I said in one of my previous posts, my reviews are based on many factors. The location, atmosphere, size of the space, bathroom, food, service, price considering all things, etc. Broccolino gets 3 stars based on the fact that it is not that cheap and the place is super small, tables are shared and the pizza comes from the next door where they have another spot. That was weird, seeing the waiter walking outside with hot food from our place to the next door place where they had customers seating. In other words, if you order pizza it comes from next door, if you seat next door and ask for food other than pizza the food will inevitably go through the sidewalk. Weird! Is that even legal? Maybe...
is trash the mariners pizza a.k.a. cheese pie had no cheese unless u ask and that's a extra 6 bucks for cheese on a cheese pie
Good

(Translated by Google) THE REAL ITALIAN WELCOME EXCELLENT KITCHEN X WHO LIKE ME IN TRAVEL SEARCH THE TASTE OF HOME  (Original) LA VERA ACCOGLIENZA ITALIANA OTTIMA CUCINA X CHI COME ME IN VIAGGIO CERCA I SAPORI DI CASA
(Translated by Google) Good music and top staff 😎👍🏾🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸  (Original) Gute Musik und Top Personal 😎👍🏾🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

Tiny space with big personality.  The staff is very helpful in getting you seated in the limited seating. The star of the show is the food. Fresh, seasoned to perfection, just delicious.  Excellent location a meal before an event at Barclay Center as it is right across the street. Make your reservations early, but if you forget, somehow you'll still get served a great meal.

Fantastic small restaurant right by Barclays Arena.  They were open late after the game on a Wednesday evening.  The food is a little pricey but it tasted delicious.  I had the Chicken alfredo and tried the pesto as well and both were delicious.  The decorations of the restaurant really made this place unique.  They brought out the check in a graphic novel as well which was funny.  I definitely recommend eating here.
Freaking delicious and the service was so genuine!!! Get all the desserts!
Broccolino is so good! Real authentic Italian with such great ingredients.
Some of the best Italian cooking around.
Waitress was not friendly, food was very expensive- not worth what it tastes. Portions were small and overall bad experience. Not coming back.
Wonderful pasta
Ordered calzone and tiramisu; calzone didn't come a marinara. Calzone was deflated and dough was under cooked. Tiramisu was dry and lacked coffee.
Ordered from them on Postmates and I was missing an item. I called and they said they would send it over... but the delivery never showed up. I went hungry that night. 😑
Loved it here! Great service and food Trip from UK. Love Brooklyn!
Great food, great staff, great beer
(Translated by Google) The food is rich but has a lot of fat  (Original) La comida es rica pero tiene mucha grasa

First time there this evening with my family from out of town. We all give this place glowing reviews, and I have a very picky sister. Our server is clearly hardworking and was extremely busy, but never forgot to check in on us (maybe hire more staff??). I'll definitely be coming back.
Genuine Italian food.. homemade pasta and wood fired pizza oven makes this the spot to have dinner with friends and family.. staff and service is excellent!
It's amazing italian place, with tasty food, so tasty that I whant to take my girlfriend there.
Love this place. Order pizzas weekly and dine in occasionally. Love the wine on draft.
This place is amazing. Our fav local Italian spot!
Seriously incredibly good food!
Local, down to earth little restaurant with amazing food!! Service was just ok although our server really tried. Definitely need to increase staffing.
Great good and ambience!
Very good! Felt like we were in Italy!
Magnificent food and atmosphere!!!...
Really good. Really really good. Will definitely be coming back.
Sit at the bar. Food is great.  Staff is better.
Great food!
The food is excellent, the service is personal.
Good tasting food, could use a better rendition
Very good food just one block from Barclays Center.
Bad service, average food, expensive menu. Don't waste your time and money.

Cute little casual Italian restaurant in Brooklyn. We decided to hop in because of the cute sign but food was very good. The burrata prosciutto was tasty with very fresh and creamy burrata. The pastas are great: highly recommend the gnocchi. It has a texture of mochi which mash really well with  the creamy sauce and the savory ham. The black linguine is firm and chewy, also pairs well with the thick and flavorful tomato sauce. The lobster was okay. Overall pretty good place and would definitely go back for the pastas (especially that gnocchi) in the future.
Great food, place to eat italian if you are near Barclay center in Brooklyn

First, service.  10/10: service was amazing, very nice staff and consistent check ups on drinks/food.  Second, food.  10/10: Let me tell you, if you’re looking for AUTHENTIC Italian food, this is your place! The beef ragu was the best pasta I have ever tasted! It was fantastic! My sister had the lasagna and she finished before any of us! We all loved our food.  Third, scenery.  The vibe was cozy! They had a little brighter than dim lighting, and it was comfy lighting. The music and the smell was mesmerizing.  Lastly, cheque.  10/10: the food was worth the price, also, the cheque came in an old Italian book! I’ve never seen something like that before. It was creative.  The only problem is that the restaurant is a bit small. It was packed, so, it was tiny.  IF they made it bigger, the restaurant would be perfect!
Great Italian restaurant.
very expensive food.
Great drinks
Food was good but wait took and hour when it was just us in the place. Need to add Peroni to the menu as well

Gluten free pasta was tasty. My favorite ragu was a little salty last time I came. Their soup of the day was carrot and very very tasty. The fries are GIANT so be prepared to eat a lot. Cute ambiance, great service, pizza is not gluten free. It is a great summer spot, but the winter walls didn't keep us very warm.
Nice restaurant,  god service, very good pizza and Tiramisu!

After looking for a place to eat a little later on in the evening my friend and I stumbled upon this restaurant and while it was completely empty, it seemed promising so we grabbed a sidewalk seat and decided to give it a try.  Considering that we were the only two patrons in the restaurant, the service was trash. We were handed menus and our order was taken, once the food was brought out, neither of the two people working the front came back to our table until it was time for the check.  I know in NYC most Italian restaurants won't bring you bread (usually you have to buy it as an app) but at a place like this, I kind of assumed they would bring at a minimum a few slices. Nothing. When our food came out, the waiter who I think was the owner? just plopped our food down and didn't offer any sort of cheeses or anything. Even though we were the only patrons in the restaurant, I couldn't help but feel rushed the whole meal.  The food itself was such a disappointment. $18 for a lasagna slice? That's steep. BUT this portion size was accommodating to the cost. HOWEVER, it was some of the worst lasagna I've ever eaten. It was so salty after maybe 5 bites I forced myself to eat it because I was so hungry. luckily I had a bottle of water with me so with every bite, I'd also just down a gulp of water to offset the taste. My friends meal was no better. It was extremely saucy with not much flavor except for tons of salt as well.  At the conclusion of our meal, they didn't' ask us if we were ready for the check, they just came over to our table with check in hand when our plates were almost empty.  Maybe we should've taken the empty restaurant during prime eating hours as a sign that we shouldn't have eaten there. I learned my lesson and won't go back.
Excellent food and amazing staff!
I wanted to give a higher rating since the staff was so nice and polite! But the dish I order was so bland. I needed to add salt to the pasta and shrimp.
I called to ask if I could make reservations. The lady that answered was extremely rude and hung up on me. Very disappointed.

We had vongole pasta. The server was kind and polite but the food was SUPER salty. I felt like that I was having overcooked ramen. I bet I can make better pasta. Considering the price, which was $18.50, It was not worth eating it.
Great Italian food
Excellent delicious food and the service was great and friendly
Food was very average, service was surprisingly poor, as waiter could not remember who ordered each dish (only two dining and only two dinners), and brought the wrong drink to me.
Service and food wonderful.  My second time going there. Love it..
Excellent food! Lasagna was light and tasty and the tiramisu was outstanding!
If your idea is a romantic dinner, best opt out of this place.  While it a small space, it lacks the quiet coziness that comes from small comforts.

Delicious, casual Italian with daily specials, homemade pizza and pasta, Italian style bar with cocktail menu to reflect the awesome marble old fashioned feel... Small restaurant near Barclay's is usually crowded, but totally worth it.
Love it! I had been dying to come to this spot for months. The service was outstanding and most importantly the food was great! I will definitely be back with friends.
Very reliable place for quality Italian food in a very casual setting. If you are going to Barclays it is a safe bet. They have wine on tap and the food is very solid.

I went here for a family dinner, at the recommendation of my sister. It did not disappoint. The staff were very friendly, the atmosphere was pleasant, service was prompt, and the food was excellent. Portions were big, and prices were lower than you'd expect from a place like this. I had some kind of pasta with duck ragu, and it was wonderful. We also got fried calamari- in my opinion, one of the easiest dishes to cut corners on or mess up. They did neither. I recommend if you are in the area and enjoy Italian food.
I love it
Very good & something you will see the new York lslanders hockey team eating there !
Great little place. Great food and atmosphere.
Wanted to find a nice Italian restaurant before the Nets game and boy did we find one. Delicious food, cozy, good atmosphere. ..strongly recommended
Lovely place with great food and great service. The pizza is phenomenal!
It's good, been here a few times, prices are a bit on the high side but the food has been good, as well as the bread. Service is quick and friendly. Will return.
Fresh, tasty and authentic Italian cuisine served with individuality. A very good choice for a simple, elegant dinner. Decent wine list and the best tiramisu I've had in NY.

Watch out for the automatic gratuity !   We only found out afterwards that we tipped the waiter twice,  increasing the bill in a sneaky way.  Of course we weren't told that service was already included in the bill.  It's an insult to the customer !

Bottom line up front: expensive price for mediocre-at-best food.  Ordered the insalata brussel and 12"meat lover pizza. The salad tasted like it was mostly shredded cabbage, but maybe that's just what shredded brussel sprouts taste like. Not worth the $11. The pizza came partially folded from the delivery guy and was cold. Perhaps not their fault, just be careful if you are ordering delivery. Also, I ordered extra mozzarella on my pizza and the cheese on my pizza is very scant. I can't imagine what it would look like without extra cheese.  Much of this I could excuse if this pizza tasted amazing. Unfortunately, it is waaaaay to salty. I'm not a picky eater but I've had this problem with other dishes here in the past. There's just better options for a cheaper price than this place.
Amazing place. You should stop by and try by yourself.
Homely Italian restaurant with outdoor seating.
Nice spot for pasta and wine

The food is spectacular. This place is up there with many of the region specific Italian places in NYC, however this is less authentic and more Brooklyn fusion style -- for what it is, the chef is quite talented. This is not s typical Italian/American so don't expect red sauce and garlic bread. Also the portions are quite large and the wines on tap are very good. We usually order delivery and keep the leftovers, however the location is a lovable Brooklyn treat. One of our favorites!
The food is incredible and the servers are so friendly. I've been here several times and it has never disappointed.
Authentic Italian, like the best Little places in Rome or Florencep

While Broccolino has a lot of potential, in my opinion, they fall just a little too short. The staff is pretty friendly, although they tend to get frazzled when it's busy (and because the place is so small, they are "busy" often). Seating is a little cramped, but that is to be expected at a place so small. And it would be forgivable if we were talking about blow-you-away-just-as-good-as-Italy-Italian-food. But...  We're not. For a place like Broccolino which basically specializes in pasta, the standard should be how good the pasta is, and here, although it is homemade, this is where they fall short. The pasta is very frequently overdone and somewhat mushy. Which is a shame, because most other things are right on. Their chicken liver crostini is excellent. And the prosecco on tap is nice and affordable, albiet not amazing. Additionally, while there is nothing wrong with their basic marinara sauce that they use as the base for most of their tomato dishes, it's not great either. It tastes like they took it right from a can, added a touch of salt and pepper, and then called it a day.  That said, the last time I was here I had the gnocchi with mozzarella and, aside from the relatively plan and uninspired basic tomato sauce, the meal was pretty good. The gnocchi were actually very well done in this dish - nice and soft and pillowy, with bits of gooey mozzarella throughout the dish. Had they added a bit more basil, this would have been a standout dish.  So my advice is - if you walk by Broccolino and it's not packed, go in and enjoy a quick meal. But if it is at capacity and there's a wait, go around the corner, down 5th ave, and pick something else.
Food is ok. Slightly overpriced for the quality.

Broccolino has some great food and some not so great food. The eggplant parmigiano was cold and had a very bitter taste to it. The pesto on the other hand was very good. Service is okay, as the waiters brought towels when a patron had spilled a glass of water on a neighboring diner.

Broccolino is a cute Italian restaurant within striking distance of the Barclays Center.  It's very small but they open up the storefront with tables on the sidewalk which allows for more seating.  It's owned by Italians (from Italy) which is a double edged sword; it makes the places feel more authentic if that matters to you, but the service is more like it is in Italy (AKA slow).  Getting their attention can be difficult, especially considering there are only 2-3 servers and they've wearing multiple hats, taking orders, resetting tables, bussing tables, etc.  Still the place has a pretty big menu for both drinks and food, and the decor/atmosphere is pretty ideal for a date spot.  The drinks here are very good, namely their 2 negronis (all I've had personally).  The difference between the 2 is one is traditional (gin, campari, sweet vermouth) and the other is their take on it (campari, prosecco, cinzano rosso).  If you want something lighter/less alcoholic, go with the latter.  Or better yet just go with any of the wines they have on tap; they also have a few beers and other cocktails available as well.  The food is good, but not great.  For appetizers, the eggplant parm is good but it's a tiny portion.  The fried calamari was decent as well, a little too heavy batter though.  Most pastas are made fresh in house which is a nice touch even though it's not the best fresh pasta in the world.  Skip the pappardelle with duck ragu, which wasn't nearly flavorful enough.  The spaghetti with white clam sauce is pretty good though.  Depending on what the gnocchi/ravioli of the day are, those can be good options.  Overall you don't really come here for the food though; you come for a date or a quick meal before heading to the Barclay's Center.
Excellent tasty pasta. Quick friendly service. Only downside was they don't have much seating.  Drop in if you're near the Barclays!
Wonderful little neighborhood restaurant with excellent pasta and wine and wonderful service.  Very cozy inside with charming decor. Highly recommended.
Great pasta with a pretty decent service. Been here a few times and I'll always be coming back.
When we're craving delicious and reasonably priced Italian before heading into the Barclays Center, this is where we run to. The Lasanga and Cavatelli Broccolino are both awesome.
